thread.title: 'What sort of patriotism is that?' Tory MP shuts down Remain heckler for BOOING Brexit
thread.title_full: 'What sort of patriotism is that?' Tory MP shuts down Remain heckler for BOOING Brexit

title: 'What sort of patriotism is that?' Tory MP shuts down Remain heckler for BOOING Brexit
text:
'What sort of patriotism is that?' Tory MP shuts down Remain heckler for BOOING Brexit 'What sort of patriotism is that?' Tory MP shuts down Remain heckler for BOOING Brexit JACOB REES-MOGG scolded a Remainer for booing him when he said the British had “got their country back”. PUBLISHED: 23:01, Fri, Jan 20, 2017 | UPDATED: 23:11, Fri, Jan 20, 2017 
The Conservative MP was part of a panel on Radio 4’s Any Questions? and was responding to a question about how long it would take for the public to “feel a positive change in everyday life”. 
The Brexiteer replied: “Well I think lots of people felt it on the 24th June when they realised they got their country back.” 
The response was met with a mixture of applause and booing from the audience on the debate show, which was broadcast from Bourton-on-theWater, Gloucestershire. 
But Mr Rees-Mogg continued: “I think that's very important – that getting our country back, getting our democracy back, being in control of our own future, not getting laws sent down to us from Brussels, and with European judges telling us what to do. GETTY Jacob Rees-Mogg received a mixed response from the audience on Brexit Related articles
